turns.text: I say Dallas area when Im talking to people elsewhere
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Thats okay its more uh concentrated so they know where you are
turns.label: bd

turns.text: Uh anyway I know here in here in Plano some of the things that we do are um Kroger and some of the other stores too have said If you bring your bags back to to the store to recycle then theyll pay you certain amount of money and thats one thing that started in the community
turns.label: sd

turns.text: They actually pay you money for that
turns.label: qy

turns.text: Um um Brookshires up in uh Allen uh you bring your bags back you know they uh the plastic bags back or the paper bags you put them in the receptacles there - but I didnt realize some people are actually paying you for that Um
turns.label: sd

turns.text: uh-huh yeah I know Kroger will do it and I think Albertsons does it sometimes Im not sure Um and and yet I know that uh some of the stores will actually help the community not pay you the money back but will pay the the uh community like through the schools --
turns.label: b

turns.text: So um thats always helpful and I know that we ha- we have the the can the can different can banks around the city --
turns.label: sv

turns.text: -- that you can go to and do that Um one of the ways - I dont know uh if this would be helpful It said on the the computer what do I think would be helpful And I dont know if it would be helpful or not but I know on Monday the the garbage men pick up like just um any limbs or any extra trash that you might have
And that might be an extra day to put out things that might be recycled if we had certain colored can to put them in or something in the city to put like either glass or newspapers or whatever
turns.label: sv

turns.text: Yeah I think they already do that out East Um they have to its little bit more difficult because people have to remember Okay todays glass --
turns.label: b

turns.text: -- okay tomorrows plastic and all that --
-- but I think thats the way we need to go Its uh its pretty bad All these years weve - been especially in this country all the uh the plastic and the paper and everything we just used to throw out
turns.label: sv

turns.text: Yeah uh I know getting newspaper everyday I know I could just you know do that --
turns.label: b

turns.text: -- because I have to pick it up and it just goes out with our trash and I guess Im not as um recycling minded as I should be but that goes out with the trash and it really could be recycled
Yeah about six months ago I started --
turns.label: b

turns.text: -- so what I do is uh - its not bad you just have to have place to keep everything but uh it youll be amazed if you ever start doing it Just put your paper in the same place every day and itll start stacking up Take your glass um you know pickle jars or or whatever uh liquid jars you know just rinse them out little bit and put them all in place and uh plastics -
Dont you have to take like labels off of those jars
turns.label: qy

turns.text: No from what I understand uh you can leave the labels on um although I rip rip them off
turns.label: nn

turns.text: I dont I dont scrub them or anything I just tear them off --
turns.label: sd

turns.text: -- throw the lids and everything out but uh put all the glass in one place and plastics like milk jugs uh orange juice jugs things like that
turns.label: ad

turns.text: Um and then of course uh cans coke cans whatever
turns.label: sd

turns.text: But uh I havent been down to the recycling center yet to find out exactly what they need or what they take and all that Ive just read lot about it and Im keeping these big piles of it right now I going to try to dump it out this weekend in fact But uh youd be amazed how quickly it all stacks up Theres lot that we throw out
turns.label: sd

turns.text: I I know with our family that we could really be helpful if we could find way to just um get it into different categories like that and --
turns.label: sv

turns.text: -- I I dont know what it would take to to get my children to start working on it I have two older ones that probably would go along with the if I had it arranged so that it wasnt big project you know
Its yeah its not big deal You get used to it One - let me tell you one interesting thing --
turns.label: sv

turns.text: -- when I went back to the store and I said Hey um I understand you all are taking these bags back uh you know what do you do with them And they told me they look through them all and throw out the ones that dont belong there and then you know go and recycle the rest And I said What do you mean the ones that dont belong there
turns.label: sd(^q)

turns.text: And they said Well people come in and put anything in the receptacles And what I found out is if you look at the bottom of those bags Kroger or whatever --
turns.label: sd(^q)

turns.text: -- the plastic ones theyve got numbers on them
Yeah and if its got the little recycle symbol and inside it its got number like bags from Drug Emporium have -
turns.label: b
